data.title: List of 112 Burt Reynolds Movies & TV Shows, Ranked Best to Worst
data.meta_description: What are the greatest Burt Reynolds movies & TV shows of all time?
data.text:
This ranking is based on an algorithm that combines various factors, including the votes of our users and search trends on the internet.

List of Burt Reynolds Movies: Ranked Best To Worst

1. Gator (1976)

86

12

PG

86

12

Role:

Gator McKlusky

Directed By:

Burt Reynolds

2. Smokey and the Bandit (1977)

152

16

PG

152

16

Georgia’s Big Enos challenges Bandit to drive a truckload of Coors Beer from Texas and deliver within 28 hours in Atlanta where Coors was not available without permit. But when Bandit picks up hitchhiker Carrie, the runaway bride of Sheriff’s son, sheriff Buford T. Justice gives Bandit a high-speed chase across the states, with police from four states pursuing the careering cars.

Role:

Bandit

Directed By:

Hal Needham

3. Deliverance (1972)

183

22

R

183

22

James Dickey adapted this movie from his 1970 novel Deliverance. The story involves four urban men who embark on a weekend canoeing trip down the wild Georgia River. However, the trip soon turns into a frightening fight for survival as the four men desperately try to get away from the merciless locals and dangerous waters.

Role:

Lewis

Starring:

Jon Voight, Ronny Cox, Ned Beatty, Ed Ramey

Directed By:

John Boorman

Miss Mona runs the Chicken Ranch, a brothel having a long history in a small town in Texas. However, a reporter named Melvin Thorpe tries to expose the brothel and shut it down. This puts the governor in a tough situation.

Colin Higgins

80

80

Sharky’s Machine is an action thriller drama film which revolves around Tom Sharky, an undercover cop who is investigating a narcotics kingpin. He soon comes across a mob murder with government ties. He assembles all his investigators and tries to bring the criminals to justice, before all his partners and witnesses are killed one by one.

Sharky

Directed By:

Burt Reynolds

11. White Lightning (1973)

94

18

PG

94

18

Bobby McKlusky is serving time in a prison in Arkansas for his illegal liquor business. However, when he learns that his younger brother Donny was murdered and Sheriff JC Connors was behind it, he manages to get out of prison, and starts to work undercover for a federal agency, in order to expose the sheriff and his wrongdoings.

Role:

Gator McKlusky

The Cannonball Run is an action comedy sports film, which tells the story of a group of competitors who take part in a wild, illegal car race across America. The eccentric participants are even willing to play dirty tricks to emerge as the winner of the race.

Starring:

49

10

PG

49

10

W.W. Bright is a bank robber who only robs the corrupt Southland Oil System gas stations. When he meets the country music band, Dixie Dancekings, they provide him an alibi and he decides to become their manager and promoter. As he helps the band make it big, ex-lawman, Deacon John Wesley Gore, is hot on his trail.

Role:

W.W. Bright

Starring:

Art Carney, Jerry Reed, Ned Beatty, James Hampton, Conny Van Dyke

Directed By:

John G. Avildsen

15. Mystery, Alaska (1999)

51

12

R

51

12

The amateur ice-hockey team of hockey-loving small Alaskan town of Mystery is scheduled to face the National Hockey League’s well-known team, New York Rangers, in an exhibition match. Keeping their internal differences aside, the townsfolk get set for the nationally televised event and join forces to encourage their team comprising of town sheriff, a high school senior, town’s grocer and a deliveryman.

Role:

Judge Walter Burns

Starring:

Russell Crowe, Kevin Durand, Adam Beach, Mike Myers, Hank Azaria, Mary McCormack

170

A period drama film that focuses on the life of a young nightclub employee who enters the pornographic film industry and becomes a popular star before eventually suffering a downfall, Boogie Nights is an expansion of Paul Thomas Anderson's mockumentary short film The Dirk Diggler Story.

Role:

Jack Horner

Starring:

Mark Wahlberg, Philip Seymour Hoffman, Julianne Moore, Alfred Molina, Thomas Jane, Don Cheadle, William H. Macy

Seduced by the charming young widow Laura Breckenridge and her money, former gambler Sam Whiskey, agrees to take on a dangerous mission with his two companions. The plot of the movie, based on Derek Lambert’s 1975 novel Touch the Lion's Paw, revolves around two jewel thieves – Jack and Gillian – who meet each other at a party and fall in love. Jack has planned a theft of $30 million in uncut diamonds but is unaware that Gillian has been blackmailed and planted by a Scotland Yard's chief inspector Cyril Willis who wants to apprehend him before retiring.

29. The Player (1992)

42

TV-MA

42

The Player is an American satirical black comedy film, which tells the story of Hollywood film producer Griffin Mill, who starts receiving threats anonymously. However, he is certain that David, a scriptwriter is behind it. He invites the latter to sort things out, but things take an ugly turn, and he ends up murdering him.

Starring:

Patrick Swayze, Whoopi Goldberg, Nick Nolte, Mimi Rogers, William Gary Busey, John Cusack, Robert Carradine

Directed By:

30. Citizen Ruth (1996)

12

6

R

12

6

Citizen Ruth is a comedy drama film which tells the story of Ruth, a poor, drug-addicted woman whose life gets complicated when she gets pregnant. A judge orders her to get an abortion, but a group of pro-life activists makes things more complicated for her, and she soon attracts national attention from those involved in the abortion debate.

Starring:

Kelly Preston, Tippi Hedren, Swoosie Kurtz, Diane Ladd, Laura Dern, Mary Kay Place

Directed By:

Alexander Payne

Silent Movie is a comedy film which tells the story of Mel Funn, who used to be a great film director in Hollywood at one point. However, his career declined due to his drinking problem. Country cousins Bo, Luke, and Daisy Duke run an illegal moonshine business for their Uncle Jesse in Hazzard County, Georgia. They use their orange 1969 Dodge Charger named General Lee for transportation. When corrupt Commissioner Jefferson Davis Hogg and his henchman Sheriff Rosco start evicting farmers unlawfully, the cousins decide to fight back.

Johnny Knoxville, Lynda Carter, Jessica Simpson, Seann William Scott, Alice Greczyn

Directed By:

Tommy Vinson is a former gambler, who was forced to give up poker years ago, after his wife had threatened to leave him. He begins to teach a college kid about playing cards, as the young man seems to have potential. However, Vinson soon finds himself pulled into the world series of poker, but a call girl tries to ruin the relationship between Tommy and his protégé.

The animated feature follows German Shepard Charlie Barkin, a casino-owner, who is killed by his former partner Carface. Seeking revenge, Charlie manages to return to earth and meets his friend Itchy. With the help of little orphan Anne-Marie, Charlie conspires against Carface. But then Charlie and Anne-Marie end up in danger where Charlie can save either Anne-Marie’s life or his own.
